Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.openbmc_fw_check.openbmc_fw_check

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase


[docs]class OpenbmcFWCheck(TestBase):


[docs]    def __init__(self, openbmc_fw, cpld_fw, bridge_ic, me_fw, bios_v):
        self.openbmc_fw = openbmc_fw
        self.cpld_fw = cpld_fw
        self.bridge_ic = bridge_ic
        self.me_fw = me_fw
        self.bios_v = bios_v
        super(OpenbmcFWCheck, self).__init__()



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the OpenBMC FW Check test")

        # Check if OpenBMC FW version matches baseline Version
        out = self.host.oob.get_openbmc_version()
        self.validate_condition(out == self.openbmc_fw,
                "OpenBMC Version %s" % (out))

        # Check if the CPLD Version Matches baseline Version
        out = self.host.oob.get_cpld_fw_version()
        self.validate_condition(out == self.cpld_fw,
                "CPLD FW %s" % (out))

        # Check if the BRIDGE-IC Version Matches baseline Version
        out = self.host.oob.get_bridge_ic_version()
        self.validate_condition(out == self.bridge_ic,
                "BRIDGE IC Version %s" % (out))

        # Check if the ME FW Matches baseline FW Version
        out = self.host.oob.get_me_fw_version()
        self.validate_condition(out == self.me_fw,
                "ME FW %s" % (out))

        # Check if the BIOS Version Matches baseline Version
        out = self.host.oob.get_bios_version()
        self.validate_condition(out == self.bios_v,
                "BIOS Version %s" % (out))
